alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 13 at 5:07PM MST until July 13 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 530 PM MST. * At 504 PM MST, a severe thunderstorm was located 13 miles southwest of Carrizo, or 35 miles southwest of Show Low, moving southeast at 10 mph. This storm will impact the Flying V Wildfire. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. Lightning. Strong, erratic outflow winds of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Dangerous conditions for fire fighters on the Flying V Wildfire. * Locations impacted include... Fort Apache Reservation. This includes Highway 60 between mile markers 298 and 307. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Hail, gusty to strong, erratic outflow winds, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
